caption: Authentic modern persian food! Kudos to the designers and owners of this place for its atmospheric indoor feel. The food is originally tasteful, looks and tastes unbelievable and the service is fantastic!
This is the best Persian restaurant in the city. So happy there is a place nearby where food tastes as yummy as my mom's! :)
We had my sister's birthday dinner here. The food and the cocktails were amazing!  She said it was her best birthday dinner ever.

Delicious food, great service. Three of us enjoyed three small plates and two mains. The fish with tamarind sauce was a standout. However, some of the cocktails didn’t quite work and the atmosphere is cold.
Incredibly rude hostess on the phone. No desire to come here in the future.

I came here with a group of 5 and the chef/owner greeted us as soon as we walked in to let them know we had a reservation. She told us what was best on the menu and told us some awesome stories. This is by far one of my top favorite restaurants in NYC now. I was nervous looking at the menu at first before going, but I was incredibly surprised by the taste and versatility of it, I didn’t taste a single bad thing and we ordered 75% of the menu. I will definitely be bringing people here that are visiting, or to just show off. I love this place! Incredible vibe, food, and staff!!
Perfect place for delicious Iranian food and perfectly-made cocktails.
Absolutely delicious. Everything on the menu is done with so much attention to detail including the drinks.

TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE. If I could give zero stars, I would. The cancellation policy for the restaurant is absolutely ludicrous and I just wanted to move my reservation to next week. I spoke to Ted originally and nicely requested to move my reservation and he was rude, condescending, and unprofessional. I called back because someone (probably Ted) canceled my reservation for me and I wanted to know if I would still be charged. The manager, Amir, answered this time and he was just as unaccommodating and rude! I will never be returning to this restaurant and I will be sure that none of my friends do as well. This is a terrible way to handle your business and this establishment needs a lesson in customer service.
Amazing food, great service and an amazing service!

If you have a craving for Persian (Iranian) food. This is the place it is as close to a Persian mom cooking it at home for you. Delicious, salivating intense flavors of home. You can't just try one dish. Everything on the menu is phenomenal. With regards to COVID. There is outdoor seating with heaters, spaced apart indoor seating is there too with window barriers spaced out to protect everyone. All employees are taking precautions to make sure everyone is safe at all times.

I had heard negative things regarding staff behaviour, so I observed carefully to see if I can corroborate, and nope! The staff were polite and helpful, really professional. And the food... As other reviewers said, the food is absolutely top class, on point & delivered with heart and in style. It's epitomised no better than in the Ribeye Steak (Kabab Torsh), a modern, western twist on a folk classic from north of Iran. It is just AMAZING. The same goes for the desserts, the Sharbat drinks, starters and sides, the menu is strong all-round: DO try this place!
Great Persian food and ambience

It's a new approach to some sort of Persian food. The outdoor sitting warmers were pretty effective. I think the food was good, but nothing great. And, it was definitely overpriced. I will not recommend it unless you just feel the need to try it

Absolutely AMAZING!!! It was cold and snowing but the service was incredible. We did wait for about 20 minutes to be seated even though we had reservations, (I don’t say this lightly) very well worth the wait. We got the Herbed Feta flatbread which was one of the best appetizers I’ve ever had. The Tea is amazing especially with the clear candies at the bottom, the Green Rice is amazing, both deserts we got were phenomenal and the very best Tadig we have ever had (ate here with my very Persian friend) One of my new all time favorite restaurants. Highly Recommend!!!!!

Creative and modern new takes on traditional Persian dishes. Wonderful flavors, service and experience. The homemade barbari bread is divine, the appetizers/spreads delicious.  The meats, both the steak and chicken entrees were cooked to perfection. The pomegranate ribeye and chicken fesenjoon were the highlights. Interestingly the tahdig (crunchy rice) left something to be desired. So did the wine list's options. But overall a great experience. Definitely worth the trip to BK and we shall be coming back.

This was my fourth visit to Sofreh and we were  so disappointed in the service that was received. It was a cold night, my friend and I were seated at the opening to the patio which does not have sufficient plastic covering-plenty of ventilation even if the plastic were extended-and was unbearably uncomfortable.  I made the huge mistake of asking if we could move to neighboring table after  the other diners had departed.   They suggested that we place a chair on the other side of our tiny table, which would break the 6 ft. distancing rule.  I was not comfortable with being so close to other diners and again asked if we could have the other table.   Such a small request became such a big deal.  The server didn't want to do it because other diners were scheduled for the table, and we would have to wait for an answer- he seemed very uncomfortable.   I asked the hostess and she gave us attitude.  After waiting for about 10 minutes, I asked the server again, as the couple had departed, in a nasty tone he said he didn't know and it wasn't up to him. He then turned his back on me.  The hostess finally came back out and started moving us to the other table without a word.  Rude.   Upon her departure, she said that if we want a warmer table in the future, then request it on Resy.  I don't think we need to worry about that, and how would I have known that it would be so uncomfortable in that spot.. For the remainder of the evening our server was unfriendly and distant.  I sent a message through Resy thinking that the owners would be interested in how their customers are being treated over such a small request, but never received a response.  I see that the attitude must come from the top-down.  This is such a shame, as the food is very good.   I have never been treated so poorly in a restaurant, I can't imagine how things would be if it were something unreasonable.   Sofreh needs to be reminded that it is in the business of hospitality!
Amazing Eggplant Appetizer, mind-blowing RibEye Steak, and delicious Cauliflower Appetizer, too. Almost all Gluten Free, and so tasty!
One of the top 10 best meals I’ve had in New York.  I’ve been here for 10 years.  Very special.
Wonderful restaurant. One of the best meals I've had in a long time.
(Translated by Google) Very rich, Persian food. Delicious.  (Original) Muy rico, comida persa. Delicioso.
Awesome meal, the lamb shank is fantastic, they have great service, and even the Chef came out to say hi too.
Best persian food!

Have you ever tried Persian food? Well, there is you chance, but you got to be lucky to get a reservation there. Usually it requires 2-3 weeks planning,  which better than any words describe this place.  The food menu,  isn't that big, but everything is very delicious... well, except their pickles,  I guess they version is very different from what we used to have here. The place isn't cheap,  but definitely a good experience, well worth it.

Come here for an early dinner with my husband and our toddler. We were promptly sat in the back patio which was well spaced out. The server was a little cold but attentive. We ordered cocktails, the eggplant dip, the meatball, bread, the pickles, the lamb, and ice cream. The also comped is rice because they were worried that we didn’t order any, which I thought was really sweet and considerate. Everything was just delicious! Like really really really delicious!!! As we were heading out the owner came out to greet us and was so warm and lovely. We will definitely be coming back and, as much as I want to try other dishes, I know we will for sure be ordering the eggplant dip, lamb, and ice cream again for sure.
I went this evening with a friend, I had no idea food could taste this good. I had the eggplant and steak. Drinks and service were wonderful.

Excellent service, impeccable food, great cocktails. We went for mine and my husbands 4th wedding anniversary. My standards were pretty low to be honest having been to a few Persian restaurants in New York and being disappointed, particularly as I am of Persian heritage, but sofreh DID NOT disappoint.  We had the whey and eggplant, plus the flatbread to start which was both amazing. For main I had the plum chicken which I have thought about everyday lol.  Will definitely be back to try the same, plus the other dishes on the menu.  Highly recommend

Good food. Love the eggplant and the rib eye. Flavors are great. I’d say it’s slightly overpriced for drinks and food. We were asked to wear a mask when the server came to take out orders but it was hard to predict when the server would come so we were constantly in alert mode, which was a weird situation. Drinks are great but again nyc price.
Outstanding spot for persian food. Service is always nice even when they have a full house. Service is typically good. This place has a nice design. Feels similar to a cafe in Chicago I liked.
Persian food, so fresh. i will be bringing family next time. menu is like a place in miami i enjoyed
Persian food, so great. the staff was very friendly and attentive. prices that won't shock you.
persian food, mmm, very tasty. You won't be disappointed in the menu and service. Had a sister come into town and asked me to take her here again. Food is like a restaurant in Jacksonville I loved.
One of my preferred spots for tasty persian food. Really nothing but good experiences here. It has an awesome feel to it. Atmosphere and food reminds me of Virginia Beach.
Loved our dinner! Takeout traveled well and we enjoyed everything. Acorn squash app, eggplant app, lamb strew, and plum chicken. Looking forward to going back when we can get an anniversary

As an avid fan of Persian food who can happily eat tahdig and ghormeh sabzi 5 nights of the week, Sofreh was a nice break from typical Persian cuisine. Sofreh can be described as "dressed-up Persian cuisine" with the chef's unique take on classic dishes like Potatoe Pancake (Kookoo seebzameeni), Smoked Eggplant (mirzah ghasemi) and new dishes that you won't typically find at a Persian restaurant like the cauliflower starter with the chili glaze and shallot yogurt and their catch-of-the-day fish immersed in a traditional herb and tamarind stew (ushe torsh) which is usually a heavy vegetarian stew eaten alone as a soup. Four stars here as they are stingy with portions and have a strict "one tahdig per table policy"...isn't tahdig 90% of the reason one goes to a Persian restaurant? It's not your Friday night homey Shabbat Persian meal that has you looking for the nearest couch to recline on, but a more refined Saturday night version that keeps the dishes and portion light enough to keep the night going.
Ok scene for Persian food. The service was very welcoming and sociable. It has a great interior.

Everything we ate was absolutley fabulous.   Dishes full of flavor with an excellent presentation. Perfect portion sizes.  Courteous and attentive staff.  A definite must visit.  I will definitely be back.
One of the best restaurant I've ever been.  Taste extraordinary,  service superb,  portions justify the price.  Highly recommended

Sofreh is an excellent representation of Iranian fare. They thoroughly demonstrated expertise by selecting canonical examples of a variety of local dishes that would be responsive to the modern American pallet.  The menu is diverse, and showcases a variety of flavors and cooking techniques that are all delicious. Even the restroom wallpaper of pre-revolution film posters perfectly accented the experience. The saffron ice cream is very traditional and a splendid way to end the experience.  I highly recommend Sofreh, there is something here for everyone.
One of my preferred places for tasty Persian food. Dropped in on Tues. Looking forward to coming back with my friends. Prices were fair. My apartment is far from here, so I can't visit often.

I have had a dinner at Sofreh yesterday. Me and my friend shared a few starters, an entree and dessert plus cocktails and wine. We had a good time catching up. Then the waitress brought a check without us requesting it. Shortly after the manager came and asked us to leave as he has a party waiting for a table. We were not informed that we had a time slot. We put our cards on the table and waited for a waitress to pick it up. Then the manager visibly stressed came back and said we had to leave as he had another party waiting for the table. We left disappointed after paying $100 a person, I came to the manager and expressed my disappointment with this treatment and said he was impolite. Nowhere in NYC I experienced being asked to leave. He replied that 1.5h is enough to have a meal and maybe I should go more places to see as this is how it goes. The worst was that when I was taking my bike I saw that no one was waiting for our table standing, but 1 party just wanted to switch table from the front yard to the backyard... Rude, arrogant service. Won’t ever go back there. And I am well rounded world traveler - I know how it goes.
persian food and the feeling at this spot is excellent. This place is absolutely outstanding. There was quick and friendly service. Atmosphere is like a restaurant in Fort Worth I loved.

A true gem particularly in these times. The food is delicious and the garden setting in the back is both very comfortable and socially distanced. The service is excellent balancing friendliness and a concern for safety.
Nice spot for delicious Persian food. Visited on a Wednesday I think. Food is like a restaurant in Jacksonville I liked.

Two words: flavor EXPLOSION. Easily one of the best meals I've had in NYC. Every dish was fresh, unique, and full of in-your-face be mindful-as-you-eat awesomeness. You MUST get the tahini & date salad, half chicken with plum and saffron sauce, the tahdig, Persian ice cream sandwich.  The outdoor space out back is adorable, beautiful, and the perfect dining ambience. Service is incredibly well-coordinated and it felt like the dishes came seamlessly as the previous course was cleared. The owner/chef even came by our table to greet us - she's TRULY the most genuine host and best storyteller. Treat yourself to some of the best food that NYC has to offer and stop by Sofreh. We're definitely coming back for the new fall menu!!

My favorite location for delicious Persian food. I love this place. The service was friendly and observant. Bring your hunger - portions are generous. Menu is similar to a restaurant in Jacksonville I loved.
A preferred site for tasty persian food. I give this place two thumbs up. Service is typically great. The bill was decent.
Great food chef is amazing ! The restaurant next door a little loud but hopefully they open indoor dining next week!

We showed up at 630, and were told we would be the next table. They assured us it would be a short wait. Then we waited 2 hours and never offered us an explanation. When we asked again they told us we may not get a table and were extremely rude. We will never go back. Covid doesn’t excuse horrible service and rude responses.

Traditional Iranian with a modern twist. Great service and even better food. Beautiful ambiance in the backyard setting. The steak and lamb were cooked to perfection. We had two bottles of wine, two appetizers, two rice dishes and three main courses. All in it was under $300 for four people.
Persian food, mmm, excellent. The service was sociable and attentive. Prices were fair for the quality of the food.
Persian food and the scene at this spot is excellent. Service is awesome even when they are busy. The service here is outstanding. This place has a nice feel to it.
Persian food... super good. visited fri evening i think. staff treated us so kindly. feeling here is similar to a place in columbus i liked.
A fav place for delicious Persian food. Service treated us so nice.

Just left. The attention we received was more than we could ask for. The food was amazing. The place was very clean. The atmosphere in the back was amazing as well. Mosquitoes on this night was a problem. Not related to the restaurant just outdoor dining.
Summer cocktails

I really enjoyed the food served in Sofreh restaurant. The taste was great, real Persian dishes!!! I visited this restaurant during pandemic and they followed Covid protocol very well. So clean!! I highly recommend you to try Persian food in Sofreh if you are in NYC. 5 star!!!

We had a fantastic time! The food was flavorful and the service was great. You must try the lamb and the chicken. There was a fish special that was excellent. If you want good food, you must visit this restaurant. We had the honor and the priviledge to meet the owner and his sister. They were friendly and gracious.
This is such a refreshing surprise! Food is delicious with original combinations. Service is great and friendly. Cocktails are strong and gooood. Will definitely come back

Not quite ready to eat out, we orders three small plates and two entrees to go for our anniversary. Everything was packed beautifully and tasted great ( each dish is special with very interesting flavors). We can’t wait to eat there, but until then, we know where we will get take out when we are feeling a little fancy.  Thanks to the chef!

My favorite takeout spot in the neighborhood! The feta and herbs was very tasty but my favorite dish was the Ghormeh Sabzi with rice. I was also surprised with how well my leftovers from last night tasted for lunch this morning. Make sure to get a cocktail as well. I had the Sekanjebin martini which was very refreshing for a hot summer day.
My meal last night was incredible! Best takeout I have had in a long time. The drinks to go are also great...my favorite is the watermelon mezcal cocktail

Extremely small proportions for high prices. while they have good meat, the extremely tangy sauces they prepare with tomato and overkill makes this place an unfortunate miss.  Look for more authentic places. This is no Persian food - it is a sour and miniature bastardization.
had a great time here with out of town friends. the owner came by our table and made great suggestions. everything was so tasty and arrived quickly. can’t wait to return.
Amazing!! The flavors of this food are going to be in my dreams for awhile.
Delicious! Great cocktails, wonderful apps, sumptuous duck and an amazing steak with a pomegranate crust.
Charming ambiance and delicious food. I don't remember the last time I've had so much saffron at one time, and now I don't know why not!

After wanting to try Sofreh since it opened, we finally made it here a week ago. Everything looked incredible and we couldn't make up our minds so we just ordered a ton of food knowing we'd have leftovers to go. We began with the eggplant & whey dip, roasted cauliflower, herb kofteh, and the feta & herb flatbread. Next up was the half chicken, mejdool date & lentil rice, and a side of tahdig. And to round out the night, we got the rose custard. Each dish was fantastic! If I had to choose a couple of favorites, they would be the roasted cauliflower and the rose custard. The service was also attentive and friendly and the atmosphere was enjoyable. Oh, and the leftovers held up well so we got to enjoy the night all over again. Too bad it's a schlep for us to get here from upper Manhattan. Still, we'll make an effort to get back before too long because there are so many other dishes to try!
Delicious, beautiful modern take on Persian classics. Great cocktails too
This restaurant is hands down the best Persian restaurant in New York. Sofreh brings a novel point of view to traditional flavors.

Great food and service. Learned that the owner herself is in the kitchen preparing dishes. Definitely on the top list for Persian cooking. Also, i have been in many restaurants but I have never seen the restrooms with projector showing old Iranian movies..pretty cool and creative!

I'd been wanting to come here since the rave reviews in the New Yorker and NYT over a year ago. It was well worth the wait and exceeded my expectations. Nasim Alikhani, the owner, greeted everyone that walked in through the door as if we were coming to her house for dinner. The originality of the cocktails hinted at the surprises to come. I've eaten around the world and cook a lot myself and yet was surprised by many of the flavors in the food we ordered. Prices can seem high but the servings are quite generous and some of the dishes (like the amazing duck) are more than enough for two people to share.

Favorite Persian spot on the Eastern side of the U.S. Delicious food and excellent ambiance. In true 2020 form, you will see tons of Insta posts of inside the bathrooms, so I guess it's accurate to write even the bathrooms have atmosphere? Hmm. :D

One of the most delicious dining experiences with very unique flavors and preparations. To try some amazing Persian food, it is worth the trip to Brooklyn. It's pretty far away from where many would look for excellent dining, but it is worth it  A very busy spot, so make sure you make reservations. Bartenders are great, and the staff is well versed in the flavors and can help you choose what to order. The lamb was incredible.

I have a thing for exposed beams, so right of bat I was impressed with the ambiance and look of the place. This is a good place for a date night. The friendly staff are also incredibly knowledgeable about their menu. I recommend the Koofteh as an appetizer, which is essentially a tasty meatball with nuts inside of it. The Persian herb stew with lentils was a blend of perfect seasoning and was only outdone by the duck entre which comes with a side of duck (breast with a side of dark meat!). You should get a side of rice to complete your meal, and dabble in the unique cocktail list. Overall, may be one of the best dinner restaurants in Brooklyn.
Very nice place! Tasty food and wine. Wear formal clothes so that you would not look awkward and out-of-place like I did. 😜

The food here was so delicious and aromatic, it’s my first time eating Persian and I was really impressed.  There were 4 of us who shared a variety of items: pomegranate feta salad with an extra bread, herb kofteh, saffron rice, half chicken and 2 lamb shank.  This was more than enough food.  The highlights were the feta salad, this was definitely my favorite and the bread and the half chicken.  I didn’t find the rice that interesting, personally and I liked the chicken better than the lamb but the lamb was incredibly tender and a sizable portion.  It took a little effort to get a reservation on a Friday night but our experience made it totally worth it.
I don't think you can get better Persian cooking at a restaurant. Sophisticated, varied, light. I could have eaten all night!

We have been to Sofreh a few times. Our first time was incredible (earlier in 2019) and everything we tried was amazing. Unfortunately, the last two times we have gone, the flavors weren’t the same and the main entree we got (Pomegranate Steak) was extremely bland. We have essentially had the same exact order every time we have gone and it’s just not the same. We informed the manager that evening, and he basically implied that the food was fine and that basically we didn’t know what we were talking about (said he had tried the food himself and knows that everything is cooked well) and didn’t validate our experience at all. The poor customer experience was really a bummer!
Delicious! Warm, welcoming environment. Felt like being at a Persian relatives home!
Amazing food and Amazing hosting!
Excellent food and service

Wonderful food in a lovely space (we sat downstairs), attentive waiter who noticed that my father had double tipped - the gratuity was already included as we were a big party and he tipped on top of that - and chased him to the curb to let him know that, and that he would be refunding the extra tip. Who does that? Really impressed.
Excellent Persian food. We tried four of the main dishes. They were all excellent. Very friendly staff and owner.
A good Persian meal every time I've gone
amazing persian food

We had a really outstanding experience at Sofreh. We love Persian food but haven't quite found an authentic experience where you can eat Persian foods that taste like they're made at home. Sofreh delivered this beautifully! The menu was so perfectly constructed to capture the essence of Persian culture and the flavors melded together very nicely. The chef introduces unique flavors like tahini, tamarind and chili so effortlessly and though these are not traditional "Persian flavors" they compliment the dishes very well. She even stopped by our table and gave us lots of interesting insight into the construction of the menu and inspiration for the unique new flavors. The classic dishes like the herb and beef stew (ghorme sabzi) and the bean and noodle soup (aash reshte) were executed to perfection. Even the more simple appetizers like the freshly made barbari bread with feta spread and the Shirazi salad were full of flavor. We really enjoyed our experience and will definitely be going back!
The spice filled aroma is the second thing you notice after the gorgeous intimate white interior. Be sure to make your reservation as this place is popular. Great for date night.
Great food and service!
Incredible food (kohlrabi rice is amazing, lamb shank, too) plan to go back many times in the future
Good food and friendly service
Everything was exceptional.
Get the steak! The ice cream sandwich looks amazing but has that BIG rose flavor, consider yourself warned

Absolutely delicious meal.  The eggplant dip was very flavorful. The flatbread is freshly made. The  caramelized carrots are sweet and the yogurt  underneath is tangy thereby balancing the sweetness.  My favorite main dishes are the chicken in plum sauce and the fish. The rosewater pistachio ice cream was absolutely wonderful.
Amazing Persian food with a twist. Love this place.

Delicious, authentic, home cooked Persian food. Don't miss the ash reshteh, kofteh and the faloodeh desert. Followed by a cup of tea to finish your meal..  the desert and Ash were outstanding. Yes, it's spruced up to suit the upscale crowd, for example not serving rice automatically with the stews which would be more traditional, but the flavors are still outstanding and well worth at least a one time dining experience.
Surprisingly delicious. Exceeded my expectations.
The food gets 4 stars. The service and drinks get 3 stars each, but the food is so good one can overlook the non-attentive service and a few undrinkable drinks.
You reserve the table, wait for 1 and a half hours and they hold your table for 2 minutes!!
Had a thoroughly satisfying meal with tasty drinks and accommodating service. Can't believe I've waited so long to visit. Already planning to return.
Excellent food and super cool private room

We were a group of four vegetarians and were well served by the options in the creative menu with the advice if the friendly and knowledgeable staff. There's a limited choice in the entrees but ample choices of starters. My favourite was the Eggplant and whey dip. The salads are fresh, crispy with a subtle dressing.

Lovely restaurant with delicious food!! We had to wait about 3 weeks to get a reservation on a weekend night, but it was will worth it. The space is very fresh and inviting. We ordered the cauliflower appetizer - cooked well with a bit of space that was balanced with a yogurt sauce. The lamb was lovely and the chicken with plum sauce was amazing! Both went well with a side of rice. Can't wait to eat here again!

We had SUCH a nice evening at Sofreh. Took our kids and the entire staff couldn't have been more solicitous. Both owners came over to offer to help us find good options on the menu for everyone and made it feel welcoming. Dips were great (which the bread had been hot, pillowy as it appears but perhaps they pre-bake for the 6 pm crowd) - highly recommend having the smoky eggplant main as an appetizer. It was lovely. The kebab was a true highlight - superb. Enjoyed the rum and bourbon cocktails, the ice cream was lovely.
Great food and wonderful service.
Delicious. Hospitable. It is terrific.

Food was delectable. Service impeccable. The catch of the day (ghelieh mahi) better than any I've had. Ever. The half chicken perfection. And that sauce! The tahdig 👌. We tried more than half the menu and it was all amazing. I could go on. But you get the point.

We loved absolutely everything we tried! For appetizers we got yogurt and meatballs which were amazing. Loved tahini and dates salad, saffron rice is a must to try.  For main we had the steak and it was just perfect and smoked eggplant. We can't wait to return! Also their cocktails are special and delicious
Food is phenomenal & service is superb! Great hospitality! Simply an amazing place.

Absolute disappointment. If you think these are authentic Persian flavors - or any sort of derivative of - you are mistaken. The best way I can describe this restaurant is that it is the La Croix of Persian restaurants in the New York City area, in other words the flavors are weak. In addition to the lack of culinary strength, the waitstaff and the hostess were cold and neglected us, adding to the negative experience. I came here with my family to have a nice meal and feel at home, instead I found myself in a pretentious environment with below average food.
The food is regularly fresh and yummy, cashiers gives good customer service. I really like how neat it is and character. Will come visit again.
Just perfect!

Sofreh was a spectacular experience, it was home away from home, a taste and vibe from the streets of Tehran, brought to Brooklyn, with a unique, authentic, and delicious menu of dishes from different regions of Iran and inspired drinks that took me to my childhood (although these were the alcohol version of those). And for all that, I sincerely thank Nasim, Amir, and the rest of the team for making it happen. I have been waiting for so long for a place just like Sofreh in the US. You can’t even find such a gem in LA that’s the Iranian hub of the US.  As for drinks, we truly enjoyed Bahar Bitter, Saffron Drink, and Sekanjebin Martini. We were surprised by a special shot of a Greek digestif, Mastika at the end - on the house.  We started with a selection of appetizers, the feta, herbs and flatbread, the meatball, and the potato pancake. My favorite was the flatbread, it tasted delicious and was a modern representation of the most iconic snack back home. The meatball was a delight with a tasty gravy and the prune and walnut in the center of it.  The mains were just as delightful, carrot rice along with Ghormesabzi, Lamb Shank, and Pomegranate rib-eye. We enjoyed every bite. Don’t forget to try the desserts, the Persian ice cream sandwich was as delicious as it was beautifully presented.  The team at Sofreh is creative and passionate, they’re working hard to bring unique Persian flavors to us. As an Iranian, I can tell you that good Iranian food takes time to prepare So some patience may be required 🙂. This was the best Persian food I’ve had in 44 countries I have visited outside of Iran, only second to my mom’s cooking.
Exceptional modern Persian food & setting like you’ve never experienced before! Worth a detour to experience a fusion of traditional flavors in a entirely new and creative way.

(Translated by Google) Very rich, different, fresh, worth it, just like very good comina decent portions, small  (Original) Muy rico, diferente, fresco, vale la pena, solo como muy buena comina porciones decentes, pequeñas
Delicious food. Horrific service. Took 1hr 45 minutes for the entrees and no one knew anything about it.
Absolutely delicious meal and cocktails. I found it impossible to stop eating the rice, it was so sweet and savory at the same time.

This restaurant is absolutely lovely.  The service was excellent, atmosphere was lively.  Everything we had was delicious. We started with the strained yogurt with shallots and chives as well as the herb kofteh (meatball).  Make sure to take some bread, put some meatball and sauce add yogurt and it makes for an incredible bite. We did order an extra bread.  Our main courses were: Striped bass catch of the day - without a doubt the best cooked fish dish I've ever had.  Rib eye kabob with pomegranate - cooked to perfection and every component worked together. Symphony in my mouth!  Saffron carrot and golden raisins rice  Burnt rice side  Pickles  All the dishes were seasoned perfectly. Nothing was over or under seasoned (even combined together).  Wrapped with the Persian sorbet.  What an experience and pricing was excellent for the quality of meal.

At first Sofreh seemed to be a warm place to dine and the hostess was very welcoming. We sat on the outside and were already eating when we were approached by a woman who said that we had to leave in 30min because she had a reservation that was coming. We definitely felt racially profiled because we were the only ones of color sitting outside and on the property. We were told outside seating was for walk-ins and we were taken aback by how we were approached and treated.  She made it clear she was the owner; assuming that was her tactic to push us out of our seats. We will not be coming back here again because FAIR SHOULD BE FAIR.
Smoked eggplant delicios Pomegrnade Ribeye steak amazing

Do yourself a favor and a take a magical tour of this culinary heaven...Persian food at its best...authentic and innovative coupled with the most diverse complex flavors that makes every morsel of food simply irresistible. Food that only Gods are worthy of...eggplant that melts in your mouth w thousand flavors, cauliflower that tastes like the best vegetable on earth, duck that French could only dream of preparing in such complexity and delicacy. Fish that tastes like heaven and lamb that just falls off the bone and let’s not forget the rice ... oh dear Not a single morsel can be wasted. And just when you think you have reached the culinary summit comes dessert please have the tea w homemade ice scream and Faloodeh cause it’s a piece of heaven on earth. God bless the owner and the chef for letting us experience taste of heaven on earth.

UNBELIEVABLE food, not for the simple palate. Each dish is incredibly complex and thoughtfully crafted. Eggplant and cauliflower appetizer and lamb and duck entrees absolutely blew my mind. The saffron ice cream almost made me cry. GO if you love yourself!!!!

I loved it!Literally the best Persian food I had in a restaurant outside of Iran! A+ in taste, quality, presentation, and creativity. The cocktails are must try as well!! I loved how each alchol was amazingly matched with certain Persian fruit/spice and traditional herbs! At the end as a friend at the restaurant said:” yes it’s expensive, but you can’t put a price on home!”
Very good experience.  I will be back soon.
Delicious food

This is a GREAT spot. Amazing Persian style dishes and the service is top notch. Try the rib eye plate for a great piece of meat that is marinated in pomegranate syrup and cooked medium. No regrets. Bring an appetite as servings are quite generous.
Interesting food, definitely worth the visit. Tastes good too!

Comfortable setting with outdoor seating. I prefer outdoors and the traffic is not a distraction from the great food. I had a chicken wrap which was huge. I could only eat half of the wrap and I was full for the rest of the day. The chicken had a great flavor all of it own, and the wrap tasted like it was home made, but forgot to ask if it was.
Beyond delicious! Everything is done in the most tasteful manner.

We ordered the eggplant and whey dip, grilled carrots & yogurt, beet & feta salad, fresh fish, and pomegranate beef ribeye (with the Persian ice cream sandwich for dessert). Bite after bite, every dish was delicious. I would recommend everything, including the offer for leftover burnt rice. The environment is also really nice, bright with sunlight, and welcoming.  A win all around.
Best Persian restaurant in NYC. It was a very memorable dining experience.
Delicious Iranian food, need to make reservation in advance

I am a big Persian food fan. I finally found the place and was so excited to eat there even knowing it’s SUPER pricey comparing to what they serve. We walked in, after a minute, the host told us we have to wait 45 minutes because they don’t have any tables. We looked around and so many empty tables inside and outside. We realized we were not wanted so we just left. The host is very rude. I don’t think I will ever go there.
OMG, the food is unbelievably tasty! Ghelieh Mahi is my favorite dish here, followed by pomegranate beef ribeye (kabob torsh- or sour kabob) and half Chicken and plum.
Amazing Persian food, best I've had outside Iran and rivals the best west coast locations. Great staff and service as well!

New favorite restaurant in New York! I managed to get a reservation for three day of at prime dining hours which must have been a cancellation because it now seems impossible to find a table anytime before 9pm. I wish they used Resy rather than open table because you can have them notify you of cancellations. Anyway - the food was absolutely incredible, we all came super hungry and accustomed to New York portions ordered way too much, the app’s are small-ish and extremely tasty (we had the eggplant, cauliflower, two of the salads) one serving of the orange rice was enough for the table, the mains are HUGE (or probably just the size they should be for $30+). We had the chicken, steak and lamb, all of which were delicious but the chicken in particular was unreal, best I’ve ever tasted. We had to take quite a lot home because we over ordered but it was worth it. Yeah... we got dessert too (I don’t know how/why), rice pudding and the ice cream which were both very nice, the ice cream in particular. If and when I can get another reservation my order would be; eggplant, date and tahini salad, orange rice, chicken, ice cream - split between 2. Oh I also forgot to mention the space is gorgeous and the graphic design of menus is really cool, all the staff were lovely and helpful with suggestions.
Good Persian food in NYC is hard to come by and Softeh has officially filled that gap.
This is one place you will not regret coming today . The food is exquisite and authentic Persian food

I've visited this place twice. Taste is good but the service is too slow. Most dishes arrived at the table room temperature...The steak was a bit disappointing; the sauce was good but couldn't mask the average quality of the steak.

Thank you for  looking after my son and his wife yesterday they came there after they got married,they all liked the food  and your hospitality and it is  shame that you are too far from us in England .Good luck.

Without a doubt one of the beat restaurants in New York. The space is so lovely and comfortable. Service is absolutely top notch, with waitstaff who seemed just as excited about the food as we were. Oh, and the food. Everything we ordered was extraordinary. Must return soon to eat more.
Great food and ambiance
Off the charts delicious food, excellent service, reasonable pricing all in a  comfort inducing setting

Yum! So delicious. We had the eggplant spread which was amazing, as was the cauliflower. The chicken and the tahdig together were delicious. My friend loved the tahini and date salad whereas I preferred the Shiraz style salad solely due to the Citrus factor. We also had the fish & the feta which were good but not amazing. Took one star off solely due to the waiter being slightly directive which we didn’t appreciate (my friend being told not to get the cocktail she wanted as it was a dessert drink & being told we couldn’t order food at the same time as drinks)
Second time there. It keeps getting better.
This place is awesome. The food is so good, the flavors and textures works so well together. You can tell the people who run it, owners, chef and staff take a lot of care. Can’t wait to go back.

Beautiful meal, great service and lovely experience! Sofreh rivals some of the best Turkish dining experiences I’ve ever had. The attention to detail on the food comes through in a wonderful melody of authentic flavors that makes you want to down every dish on the menu.  To up-level the experience, the cocktails are a stunning complement to the meal. The drinks alone rival the best mixology locations in the city.  Atmosphere, food, cocktails make it one of the best in the neighborhood and city for a special night out.
Oh my god.  Magic!
The food was beyond amazing. The atmosphere is great, the staff are professional but the hospitality takes the spotlight and was the best one can ask for, ita a must!!
You'll have to book in advance but it's going to be worth it. The half chicken is incredible.
Delicious food, good service, unique venue. Would definitely come back!!
Wow! I do believe I love the flavors of Iranian food. Cozy space, friendly staff, adult vibe. Tasty cocktails, though the wine selection could use attention.
Great food and even better atmosphere!
Excellent Persian food. Best I've had in New York. Pricy but worth it.

The light and open space welcomes you as soon as you step in. Friendly staff and a menu full of options that make it hard to choose. In the end, the duck (a generous portion of duck), the yogurts, the rice and everything else we tried was outstanding. Can’t wait to go back.

Incredible Persian food! Very modern and beautiful setting! Had potentially the best steak I have ever had! Very freiendly greeting by owner, and same as leaving the owner came over and made sure we had a good time : )

What is it good for? Smaller group (2 to 4) interested in Middle-Eastern food with a high-class twist.  As a Persian, I loved this restaurant! The main dishes are incredible, classics with an upscale twist. We ordered the chicken, the lamb and the catch of the day. All were delicious but the fish (striped bass) was the best, so flavorful, and of course, the rice was the perfect texture.
Simply impeccable. The dates & sesame salad, lamb shank, orange & carrots rice, and finally ice cream cake were all out of this world.
get the lamb shank... a great place to share food. beautiful restaurant and equally beautiful food.

Sofreh is the restaurant you are looking for when you can’t travel to the land from whence this exquisite cuisine was born. An elegant space, filled with light. The owner visits the table and you have a chance to ask questions, and thank her. Do not, under any circumstance, leave without ordering dessert. Every dish here is delicious beyond compare. Service is thoughtful but unobtrusive. pro tip: you can’t get a reservation - call on the telephone!
Tasty food, pricey though

An outstanding meal, the cauliflower app is one of the best things I have ever eaten, and the duck was also exceptional. Loved the eggplant app too, the only thing I thought was  overly hyped  was the saffron rice, which was beautiful and lovely rice, but everything else was just simply outstanding. Don't getting a reservation here.
Beautiful restaurant, amazing energy, the staff is sooo nice and the lady who owns it is the grandma we all wish we had! Food was absolutely delicious!!! The desserts to die for!

If you're a fan of Persian food you'll be thrilled by Sofreh and if you're new to it, I couldn't think of a better place in New York for a more inviting first plunge.  The menu is concise which might leave some disappointed or at the very least surprised that such and such dish is omitted but Persian cuisine is of enormous depth and breadth and I suspect that it makes more business sense this way rather than try to cover as much ground as possible.  What you need to know is that whatever made it on the menu is perfectly executed and the food (with the exception of the desserts) is phenomenal and should preferably be shared and enjoyed family style.  From the appetizers we had the eggplant spread (!!), the yogurt and shallot drip and the kofteh. All were very good and enjoyed with extra servings of the Sofreh bread.  We also had the Tahini and date salad and quickly ordered another one as it was that delicious.  From the mains we had the half chicken, the lamb shank and the half duck. The chicken is an absolute must-get, the duck is also really good but the lamb I found good but not spectacular.  The desserts were the most disappointing part, we had the carrot halva and the ice cream, neither of which matched the tastiness of the previous dishes. Next time, I might just finish the meal here with a hot tea.  Finally the service although at times a bit slow, was friendly and pleasant.  Overall Sofreh lives up to the hype, is a reservation worth waiting for and I'll look forward to coming back and to bring my Persian friends here.
Delicious
Overall good food. Quite expensive though.
Really great food
Amazing food
Middle eastern food. Don’t miss the smoked eggplant dish. Big but cozy feel.

My first time dining at Sofreh was in Oct 2018, my friend and I had a great time and needless to say my experience the second time around not only met previous expectations but also surpassed them.  Staff/Service: Kind, Informative, and attentive. Food: Delicious, nurturing, and good as a home cooked meal. Ambiance: Great lighting, design, and lay out.  Also, let's not forget to mention the Cocktails! Saffron Vesper is my FAV.  I HIGHLY recommend Sofreh, the owners and staff treat you like family and the experience is a memorable one.
Beautiful & Authentic Ambiance Unique Menu Extraordinary Cuisine An owner with more passion & heart than anyone I’ve seen.  Must visit.

Some of the best food I've had in NYC, first time eating Persian food. All the flavors were so complex. The appetizers were great, and the lamb was amazing. I recommend that or the pomegranate rib eye steak. Cocktails are great too and for the quality I think prices are reasonable. Staff is very friendly and the owner makes a point to chat with all the guests, very cool. Will definitely come back

The owner makes you feel like you’re at her service and doing her a favor rather than being given quality service. She is so condescending and self righteous you almost feel like you’re back in the principals office and yet you’re paying an arm and a leg to be there for tiny portions. It might be a creative idea to have a Persian restaurant that doesn’t serve kabob but it’s not a spiritual experience to be kicked out after spending $80 a person for way over hyped food that isn’t supposed to be bougie in the first place. As an anthropologist and media studies of the middle east specialist I did adore the bathroom wall paper of old Iranian films but the attitude and lack of customer service from the owner and staff was not that of middle eastern style hospitality, manners or grace. I don’t recommend visiting an establishment that makes you unwelcome and indebted to them! Super unprofessional, inappropriate and rude to scold us for their bad reservation policy and system! Really destroyed what a positive night could have been.

Literally every dish is incredible. All the food is so full of flavor and creative, an exciting modern take on traditional Persian dishes. Cocktails are a highlight. Seating can be a bit tight for groups bigger than 4 - would recommend limiting to this size. Service was a big drawback when they first opened but they have definitely worked out the kinks and it was an amazing experience from start to finish. I would eat here every day if i could. There is really no place like it in NYC.  Don't miss: - Cauliflower - all the dips with house-baked bread - tahdig (crispy rice) - persian ice cream sandwich
Food and service we're top notch!

Absolutely exquisite food. I’ve been to many Persian restaurants and grew up with the cuisine. I have never been to an Iranian restaurant with such outstanding food. The attention to color palette and plating is truly remarkable and the owner was lovely. I typically don’t enjoy Iranian restaurants as much as food cooked at home because the decor is usually dark and old fashioned. The decor here was very bright, modern, and overall refreshing. Our waiter was excellent. There was also an amazing utilization of acidity in the food which I have not experienced in many other restaurants. I read some of the lower reviews of the restaurant and while I understand some may be displeased with the lack of some “traditional” dishes on the menu, for me it is what made it stand out. The food was surprisingly not as rice centric as typical dishes but all the food was delicious, inspired, daring, and undeniably Persian.

Like everyone else, I worked hard to get a reservation at Sofreh and was so excited to go on what ended up being the night after my engagement. What a great way to celebrate! Sadly, the restaurant came close to ruining the celebration.  Our reservation was for 6:30 and we arrived on time. By 7:45, we had not received our entrees. We asked the waiter, who told us the food would be there "in a couple of minutes," and when there was no sign of it ten minutes later we asked the manager. He proceeded to tell us that our reservation was "during the rush from 6-7" and "the kitchen gets backed up," basically telling us to be patient without apologizing. ...Okay, so it's our fault for getting the only reservation that we could?  I'll admit that, when they came, the entrees were extraordinary. The smoked eggplant is rich and hearty, the bread that accompanies it is stunning, and the sauce accompanying the chicken is nuanced and complex. But the restaurant's poor response to our delayed food -- and the length of the delay in the first place -- spoiled the experience.  Appetizers also were disappointing. The cauliflower was well-seasoned and had great accompaniments on the plate, but $12 for three cauliflower florets is daft, even in Brooklyn. I liked the meatballs and the broth accompanying them, but my fiancé thought the meat was dry (and other reviewers have said the same).  Skip the appetizers, enjoy the entrees, and maybe wait until they've ironed out the kinks before you go.

I am so disgusted by what I was faced with yesterday.  I was disappointed to see the main Persian dishes such as "ghormeh sabzi" or "gheyme polo" or "khoresh karafs" was not on the menu. But this is not at all what caused me to leave this restaurant.  when I asked the owner (with a smile and softly) why some of the most popular foods are missing from the menu I was responded by NASIM "because we choose not to have them". which didnt sound very nice . I said but those are the most favorite foods by persians at which point she responded with "we dont care to attract persian customers. this woman is absolutely rude. she does not have a SINGLE khoresht on her menu clearly because those are the most diffiicult dishes to make and instead of kindly offering other options (if not appologizing) she had nothing but rudeneess to offer. I dont recommend this restaurant to anyone. I left and went to 132 montague st owned by a very sweet young couple who offered us the BEST kashke bademjoon and ghormehsabzi with the ultimate hospitality.
Subtle flavors, generous portions, relaxed atmosphere.

The service at Sofreh was superb! And the food lives up to expectations, too. There are several items that seem standard but are the standouts – like the spinach yogurt dip, charred eggplant, and rose water ice cream with pistachios. Then there’s the aquafaba cocktails. Beans and booze, what’s to lose?
Unusual and interesting food (Iranian), prepared with care, served by the charming owners who are always willing to chat about their food and their restaurant.

A beautiful experience. We booked our table long in advance and it was definitely worth the wait! From the beginning to the end it was a song of flavors ! Everything was cooked perfectly and delicious, from the tahdig to the vegetable stew to the pistachio and rose ice cream. With its perfect decor, it was a wonderful trip to the Middle East in an evening. Very reasonably priced for the quality.

Lovely dinner with exotic flavors of the middle east. We had braised lamb shank with fava beans and crispy onions, which was falling off the bone and savory, and a spinach stew with short ribs and prunes, sweet and warming. A salad with whipped feta and pomegranate was a nice starter. Don't skip the strained yogurt with cucumber and herbs, served with toasted flatbread. Wine list had some nice choices from France  and Italy (Persian wine does not exist), but somewhat expensive. The downstairs area with communal tables is significantly quieter than the upstairs dining room.

Lives up to its high reputation. Warm atmosphere with excellent regional cuisine. Inventive bar menu with good wine list. We enjoyed our particular selections of eggplant, salad, and chicken with basmati and crispy rice.

My sister in-law and her husband raved about this place for a while and of course got us reservations while I was in Brooklyn. The ambience and little bits of art around the entire restaurant was intriguing. The food was definitely on point and excellently prepared. Definitely recommend the beef tongue starter (they had prepared it perfectly and even had the right type of pickles to go with it) + the lamb shank! Very pleased with the whole experience and excited to come back again on my next visit.
Portions are small. Having to pay extra for rice seemed...well, extra. Food is so-so. Staff is nice. The bill left me with a little sticker shock.
Some of the best Iranian food I have ever had.
Loved the food. Very inexperienced service
Delicious Isfahan flavours at this wonderful Iranian restaurant
Awesome food! Super delicious made a great experience for my family.

Perfect dish after perfect dish after yet another perfect dish! And let’s not forget about the unique (and delish) cocktails (the martini and mezcal drink were my fab choices for the night). All of this served within a beautifully minimalistic and modern space, my first meal at Sofreh surely will bring me back many more times— IF I can manage to get a reservation in the next 3 months!
Great to see a Persian restaurant that changes it's menu with the seasons and has other options besides kebabs -- delicious stews and drinks! Looking forward to going again.

I was so excited to come to this restaurant, as reviews sounded incredible, we arrived at 8 pm, the host told us 45 min wait and took our name down also our phone number to text us. We waited on the sidewalk. 45 min later (this is the second time during the wait) we check with the host, he says “oh no more seating for tonight”, we leave shocked and dismayed and offended. He didn’t even have the decency to apologize. The owner stood by and stared silently into the horizon. Crazytown!
Rude and overhyped. Don’t waste your time.
Waited for a table for 45 minutes and we were rudely told that they would not seat us. Then we saw them seat another table a few minutes later. Discriminatory practice.

I seriously cannot recommend Sofreh enough, it is AMAZING!  I specifically went into Brooklyn to check this place out and was so glad I did.  When I stopped eating meat, one of the things I missed most was Persian food.  I could not believe how many great options they have, from various veggie salad and sides, to an incredible eggplant entree, to a different fish option everyday.  Don't even get me started about the huge CRISPY TOP on my Tahdig or the rose custard . . . Cocktails, vibe, staff, etc., were all amazing.  I'll be hitting this place up every time I'm in NYC, so jealous it's not on the West Coast!!
Very rude unprofessional service.
Food was great. It was a little loud and a tad slow but very comfortable and tasty.
Delicious and lovely owners

Most awesome food. It is not your usual kebab and khoresht Persian restaurant. The chef (who is always going from table to table greeting everyone) serves more interesting Persian dishes with a modern twist.  They are new to restaurant industry and still need to work on timing of service, but well worth the trip.

Great New Persian Restaurant in town. The menu is well curated, cocktails are exotic. This is not quite a traditional serving, it’s more of a contemporary concept of Persian food, however the food tastes great. High quality and nice service. The portions are a bit smaller than regular Persian food cuisines. You’d better book in advance.
Absolutely the most delicious meal, service and place to dine. Can't wait to return.
Love it here, food was amazing

Sofreh is a new super hip restaurant with an amazing atmosphere. The food is insanely flavorful and authentic. Not to mention the drinks are all amazing and refreshing (both alcoholic and non alcoholic). The owner of the restaurant is very very warm and walks around ensuring everyone is enjoying themselves.
I really enjoyed the food here, very pleasant modern Persian cuisine, great service, and a nice atmosphere. I'll definitely be back

Special of the day: DISCRIMINATION disgusting to give patrons who enter the restuarant after you do a seat and tell YOU to come back in an hour. none of us had reservations but they spoke Farsi so I guess they get a table.  HORRIBLE WAY TO RUN A NEW BUSINESS
(Translated by Google) Behtarin 👌🏻  (Original) Behtarin 👌🏻

Food is good; hit or miss with service. First time I had dinner well before dinner rush and service was appropriately attentive and advice on menu was appreciated. I went back recently at prime time and I didn’t think the staff can handle it. Our server forgot my drink, and there was about an hour between hour apps and entrees. The servers seemed somewhere between aloof and tentative. The owner had to step in and clear the table, the overall mood of the staff was not conducive to a lighthearted meal with friends. But I’ll give them another chance, the food is worth it. Lentil stew is awesome as is the eggplant appetizer. Those are my favs. The chicken is cooked well, moist and tasty. House made bread is delicious.

Finally! An authentic Persian food paradise in Brooklyn! From the first sip of my pomegranate bourbon cocktail to the last bite of perfectly cooked tahdig (crispy rice), I was in Iranian culinary heaven. The owner, Nasim, is a typical Persian Mom: wonderful hostess, beautiful spirit, and kickass cook. Try the chicken dish and the eggplant.

This place is run by a Persian mom and the food reflects that!  Awesome service, crafty cocktails, great food.  Order the crispy rice but call it Tah-deek.   (Phonetic) Authentic for real.  Just go there, eat food and sock-it-basch. (Also phonetic)

We were 4 Persians dining with very high expectations and they were exceeded! Lots of modern takes on classic dishes. It’s not your typical Persian chelo kebab restaurant. Also the decor and ambiance are tasteful and welcoming. We will definitely come back. It’s absolutely worth the trek from Manhattan.

Unique in offering the dishes usually reserved for family kitchens in Persian homes. Sofreh prioritizes quality over quantity and will be how I hope to introduce all my friends to this wonderful cuisine and culture. Such a wonderful new addition to Brooklyn and NY.

Far and away the best Persian food I have ever had. Came in with a group of 4 and was seated pretty quickly on a Sunday night. We ordered a bit of everything and didn't have a single dish we didn't like. The smoked eggplant and the plum chicken were my favorites. Highly recommended.

What a wonderful place! I went to Sofreh last week after hearing about its delicious food. My expectations were high and yet the experience of Sofreh met all of them, and more. I ordered the Lori Kebab with its delicious walnut pomegranate sauce. I loved the bread that came with the main course. Drinks were exquisitely unexpected, and of all the incredible desserts, the Persian rosewater sorbet was my favorite. Beside the divine flavors, the space is beautifully designed, no detail is left out, lights cast a soft atmosphere, and Persian music is in the background. Special mention to the hospitality. Cheers!
I loved the Esfahan gin fizz, the ash, the lori kebab and especially the rose custard. I will definitely be going back.
Some of the best Persian dishes I have ever had in a very modern space. I highly recommend the chicken and smoked eggplant!

I dined here with my gentleman wanting to introduce him to more traditional iranian food, which this restaurant seemed to have. The hosts and owners and service is really great and friendly. The atmosphere is relaxing and beautiful with white and wooden interior design. When it comes to the food, they have a small menu focusing on dishes from north and southern Iran!  Having an iranian background with a mother from north and a father from the south with excellent cooking skills I am well familiar with all the dishes, particularly the white fish dish. The dishes seems to be adapted to suite the western taste while looking aesthetically presentable, which is to be fully respected. The white fish dish was indeed created in such a manner, where as the fish was fried and placed on the sauce. This fish sauce being from the southern part of Iran is indeed supposed to be more spicy and cooked with the fish to give it the actual flavour. The sour cherry drink was also quite watered down and not much taste to it- it was more like thick paste mixed with the water. The lamb shack was well done and was a good portion in its traditional sauce, so worth a try. The rice however, was not as expected for both dishes, contrary to the great traditional rice cooking as per the iranian style. The broad bean rice had little flavour and in addition to the dill had another herb added to it which made the taste way too strong. The crispy rice was quite oily and almost burnt, so it was not as expected. Overall I can say it was a good attempt to present iranian traditional food to the unknown. So definitely worth a try for the adventurous foodie.
Delicious food. Fantastic service and exquisite interior.
A beautiful dinner in a lovely space with wonderful hosts.
Really good Persian food.  Friendly service.  Smoked eggplant, chicken, and lamb we're amazing. Dessert was a bit of a miss though

Excellent addition to the neighborhood! The ambience is very nice, the food is not only delicious but really with the Persian spices and flavor. The staff is very professional, kind and ready for you and your questions all the time.
Excellent addition to the neighborhood. The lamb was succulent and the rice was fluffy and tasty. Great service in an amazing setting.

Love this place. Finally a restaurant that serves home-cooked Iranian food. For appetizer, we tried the eggplant (smoked perfectly) and the sour-cherry-metballs (wonderful flavor and texture). For dinner, we tried the lambs shank and the white fish. Both were excellent (the white fish is a very special dish that is hard to get right, and this place got it right.) The deserts were divinely flavored. The atmosphere is awesome. The price very reasonable ($28 for a large shank that we ended up taking home. I don't know anywhere else you could get this.) I will go back and take my friends to show them what Iranian food really tastes like.

We happened upon this place last night and they were able to take us without a reservation, which was great because this place was fantastic!  It sounded like everything was housemade. We had the shallot yoghurt dip with homemade bread, the plum chicken, lamb shank, and Persian ice cream, and traditional tea. My brother and I both have a lot of experience with Persian/Iranian cuisine, and this place didn’t disappoint. Every bite was great, and the owner and her staff were all very friendly. I can’t wait to come back next time I’m in the area.

New. A gem. Incredibly delicious Persian food in a beautiful, modern, laid-back decor. I recommend the appetizers. All very fresh and so tasty. Loved entrees (had lamb shank and tried my friends’). Desserts are to die for. Enjoy!
Loved this place! Great vibe, staff and food that you've never tasted before served in contemporary diahed.

Delicious food in beautifully designed restaurant with lovely staff! The menu is very well thought bringing some Persian food jewels that is harder to find at your typical Persian restaurant to Brooklyn  Make sure to get drinks and desserts, everything is made local and tastes out of this world!

My first experience of Persian food, and what a wonderful introduction! The website promised adventures in just the tastes I love, fusions of tart and savory using ingredients such as pomegranates, cherries, saffron, cumin, nuts, mint, garlic, tamarind, lime, lemon in amazing complex presentations. My opening night meal of spicy white fish (spicy was more a slow burn than the fiery spice of other cuisines) sent me to text friends to come back with me the next night, and the owner remembered me from my friend's telling her my name! Appetizers of meatballs with cherries, lamb & lentil patties, and olive tapenade preceded equally excellent chicken with plum, saffron and barberries and slow cooked lambshank. The rosewater sorbet was a perfect finish. Wine is available, a crisp rose goes really well. This place is a must go.

For those of you who want a literal (and also figurative) taste of Persian food and culture, Sofreh is a must-visit.  The menu is incredibly authentic and well-rounded from the simple yet delicious appetizers to the entrees.  Sofreh is not your run-of-the-mill kebab and rice Persian restaurant.  The rich recipes accurately show the breadth and diversity of true Persian cuisine with sublime flavors like barberry, saffron, sour cherry, cumin, dill, rose water, and of course lemon, to name just a few.  From my first bite of expertly seasoned lamb and salad to my last bite of saffron ice cream, I was truly in a culinary nirvana. I was blessed to visit Sofreh on its opening night after anxiously awaiting its opening for years.  In addition to the exquisite menu, the ambiance and decor are stunning and tasteful. I will surely be returning in the near future!
